string.text: Thompson M1A1

The Thompson is a blowback-operated, air-cooled, magazine-fed selective-fire submachine gun.
 This variant of the Thompson has a significantly reduced fire-rate and a simplified design produced on request of the US Army. As a result, the Blish lock, oiling system and compensator were removed. Despite having a slower fire-rate, the gun is much worse to shoot than the 1921.
 This variant also has a different receiver than the 1921/1928 variant and thus will not accept drum mags

The Thompson is a blowback-operated, air-cooled, magazine-fed selective-fire submachine gun.
 This variant of the Thompson also nicknamed as the "Chicago Typewriter" features a faster fire-rate and the Blish Lock system for weapon operation.
